title: US Influencer Shares Her Biggest Struggle With Dinner Traditions In India - News18
summary:
US Influencer Shares Her Biggest Struggle With Dinner Traditions In India

Date: January 05, 2025

Source: News18

American influencer Kristen Fischer highlights the cultural differences in dining traditions between India and the United States, particularly how meals signal the end of socializing in India compared to the US.

  • Fischer has been living in New Delhi since 2011.
  • In the US, food is served immediately upon guest arrival, while in India, meals are served later in the evening.
  • Fischer struggles with being hungry while waiting for meals when visiting friends.
  • She notes the cultural expectation to socialize before eating in India is a significant challenge for her.
  • Fischer reflects on experiences where dinner is served late, often after 11 PM.
“This was, and still is, the hardest cultural difference for me coming to India.” - Kristen Fischer

The cultural differences in dining traditions highlight the challenges faced by those adapting to new cultural norms while living abroad.
newTitle: US Influencer Discusses Dinner Traditions in India

title: PM Modi cites The Indian Express report, slams AAP over money spent on ‘Sheesh Mahal’ - The Indian Express
summary:
PM Modi cites The Indian Express report, slams AAP over money spent on ‘Sheesh Mahal’

Date: January 5, 2025

Source: The Indian Express

Prime Minister Narendra Modi criticized the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) for its expenses on the Sheesh Mahal, using a report from The Indian Express to highlight allegations of corruption during a recent rally.

  • PM Modi referred to The Indian Express report based on a CAG report about the Sheesh Mahal expenses.
  • AAP reportedly spent Rs 33.66 crore on renovations for Kejriwal's office during the COVID-19 pandemic.
  • Modi stated that AAP's focus was on the Sheesh Mahal instead of aiding citizens during the pandemic.
  • He remarked that he could have also built a Sheesh Mahal but chose to prioritize housing projects for citizens.
“You will be pained to know that when people were fighting Covid, when they were running around to get medicines and oxygen, their (AAP’s) entire focus was on making Sheesh Mahal.”

Modi's remarks underline a broader political strategy as Delhi elections approach, emphasizing accountability and responsibility in governance.
newTitle: Modi Criticizes AAP Over Sheesh Mahal Expenditure Amid Pandemic

title: Delhi News Live Updates: Citing CAG report accessed by The Indian Express, PM Modi slams Kejriwal over money spent on ‘Sheesh Mahal’ - The Indian Express
summary:
Delhi News Live Updates: Citing CAG report accessed by The Indian Express, PM Modi slams Kejriwal over money spent on ‘Sheesh Mahal’

Date & Source: Published by The Indian Express

In a recent rally, Prime Minister Narendra Modi criticized Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal for excessive spending on the renovation of his official residence, highlighting a report by the Comptroller and Auditor General (CAG).

  • Modi pointed out that Rs 33.66 crore was spent on renovations initially budgeted at Rs 7.91 crore.
  • This included Rs 96 lakh on curtains and Rs 39 lakh on kitchen equipment.
  • Modi also inaugurated a new 13-km section of the Delhi-Meerut RRTS corridor during the event.
  • The BJP has announced its first list of candidates for the upcoming elections targeting Kejriwal and his party.
“The party only focused on 'Sheesh Mahal',” Modi stated, referencing the lavish spending.

The criticism highlights ongoing political tensions in Delhi as elections approach, with the BJP positioning itself against the AAP's governance.
newTitle: PM Modi Criticizes Kejriwal's Spending on 'Sheesh Mahal'

title: PM Modi inaugurates Krishna Park Extension: All you need to know about first section of Delhi Metro Phase 4 - Hindustan Times
summary:
PM Modi Inaugurates Krishna Park Extension: First Section of Delhi Metro Phase 4

Publication Date: Jan 05, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated the Janakpuri West-Krishna Park Extension section, marking the opening of the first segment of the Delhi Metro Rail Corporation’s (DMRC) Phase 4.

  • PM Modi inaugurated the Janakpuri West-Krishna Park Extension stretch, the first section of the Delhi Metro Phase 4 today.
  • Passenger services will commence on the section on the Magenta Line from 3 pm Sunday.
  • The services between Janakpuri West and Krishna Park Extension will be available at a frequency of 16 minutes initially to ensure a smooth scaling up.
  • After the Janakpuri West and Krishna Park Extension addition, the Magenta Line will now become about 40 kilometres long.
  • The rest of the Magenta Line extension from Krishna Park Extension to RK Ashram Marg will be completed in phases by 2026.
  • The first Metro train, consisting of six coaches, procured by Delhi Metro for its Phase-4 operations, arrived in November last year.
  • The Janakpuri West-R K Ashram Marg extension of the Magenta Line will receive 144 new coaches (24 trains), ANI reported.
  • The section will include a single new station, Krishna Park Extension, extending the operational Magenta Line from Botanical Garden metro station to Janakpuri West.
  • PM Modi will also lay the foundation stone for the 26.5-kilometre Rithala-Narela-Kundli (Sonipat) Metro corridor under Phase 4.
newTitle: PM Modi Inaugurates Krishna Park Extension: First Section of Delhi Metro Phase 4

title: PM Modi in Delhi live updates: ‘Let’s get rid of AAP-da’ says PM Modi in Rohini rally - Hindustan Times
‘Disgusting mentality’: Congress reacts to Ramesh Bidhuri's 'cheeks' remark for Priyanka Gandhi - Hindustan Times
summary:
Congress Condemns Ramesh Bidhuri's Controversial Remark about Priyanka Gandhi

Publication Date: Jan 05, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

The article discusses Congress leader Supriya Srinate's reaction to Ramesh Bidhuri's controversial comment about Priyanka Gandhi, criticizing it as a reflection of an anti-women mentality within the BJP.

  • Ramesh Bidhuri made a sexist remark comparing the smoothness of roads to Priyanka Gandhi's cheeks.
  • Supriya Srinate condemned the statement, calling it reflective of a disgusting mentality towards women.
  • Bidhuri defended himself by comparing his comment to a past remark by Lalu Prasad Yadav regarding Hema Malini.
  • The BJP has officially nominated Bidhuri as a candidate for the Kalkaji assembly constituency.
“BJP is extremely anti-women. Ramesh Bidhuri's statement regarding Priyanka Gandhi is not only shameful but also shows his disgusting mentality towards women.” - Supriya Srinate

The controversy adds to the ongoing discussions about the treatment of women in politics, especially regarding comments made by male politicians.
newTitle: Congress Condemns Ramesh Bidhuri's Controversial Remark about Priyanka Gandhi

title: Delhi to Meerut South in 40 minutes: All about the Namo Bharat RRTS corridor inaugurated by PM Modi - Hindustan Times
summary:
Delhi to Meerut in 40 Minutes: Namo Bharat RRTS Corridor Inaugurated by PM Modi

Date: Jan 05, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

On January 5, 2025, Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated a 13-km section of the Delhi-Meerut Regional Rapid Transit System (RRTS) corridor, significantly reducing travel time between Delhi and Meerut.

  • The RRTS corridor connects Sahibabad in Uttar Pradesh to New Ashok Nagar in Delhi.
  • The full 55-km RRTS corridor includes 11 operational stations.
  • Passenger services are set to commence at 5 PM with trains running every 15 minutes.
  • Fares are ₹150 for standard coach and ₹225 for premium coach.
  • The newly inaugurated section has a 6 km underground stretch, including key interchanges with the Delhi Metro.
  • The project aims to improve regional transit and includes 16 Namo Bharat stations.
“Delhi is now seamlessly connected to Meerut, cutting travel time by a third.”

This inauguration marks a significant expansion of the RRTS network, providing efficient and speedy transport options in the region.
newTitle: Delhi to Meerut in 40 Minutes: Namo Bharat RRTS Corridor Inaugurated by PM Modi

title: Coast Guard Chopper Crashes In Gujarat's Porbandar, 3 Dead: Sources - NDTV
summary:
Coast Guard Chopper Crashes In Gujarat's Porbandar, 3 Dead: Sources

Publication Date: Not provided Source: NDTV

An Advanced Light Helicopter of the Indian Coast Guard crashed in Gujarat's Porbandar, resulting in the deaths of three crew members. The helicopter was on a routine sortie when it caught fire after crashing into an open field.

  • The ALH Dhruv helicopter was reportedly attempting to evacuate an injured person from a motor tanker.
  • The reason for the crash is under investigation.
  • A few individuals on the ground were also injured and are receiving treatment at a local civil hospital.
  • This incident echoes a previous crash in September where three crew members went missing after their helicopter fell into the sea.
  • Following a series of incidents, a safety audit of the ALH Dhruv fleet was conducted, addressing design and metallurgy issues.
“The Indian Coast Guard has a total of over 325 ALH Dhruv helicopters, all of which underwent technical checks.”

This tragic event underscores the ongoing concerns regarding the safety and operational readiness of the helicopter fleet. Further details about the victims and the crash's cause are awaited.
newTitle: Coast Guard Helicopter Crash in Gujarat Claims Three Lives

title: Coast guard helicopter crashes in Gujarat during training, 3 dead - Hindustan Times
summary:
Coast guard helicopter crashes in Gujarat during training, 3 dead

Date: Jan 05, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

An Indian Coast Guard Advanced Light Helicopter (ALH) Dhruv crashed during a training sortie in Gujarat's Porbandar, resulting in the death of all three crew members aboard.

  • The helicopter faced technical difficulties before the crash.
  • The incident occurred during a routine training flight at the Coast Guard Air Enclave.
  • All three crew members, including two pilots, were killed.
  • The Coast Guard is currently investigating the incident.
  • This crash follows a recent safety upgrade on the ALH fleet due to prior accidents.
  • The Dhruv fleet has faced safety concerns and had been grounded previously.
"Three crew members were killed in the incident," a police official was quoted as saying.

The Coast Guard's investigation will determine the next steps following this tragic event, which reflects ongoing safety challenges with the helicopter fleet.
newTitle: Helicopter Training Crash in Gujarat Claims Three Lives

title: Prashant Kishor joins BPSC aspirants' protest, urges Tejashwi to lead the agitation - Hindustan Times
summary:
Prashant Kishor Joins BPSC Protest, Urges Tejashwi Yadav to Lead

Date: Jan 05, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Prashant Kishor joined students protesting against the Bihar Civil Services (BPSC) exam early Sunday, urging RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav to lead the demonstrations.

  • Kishor expressed solidarity with students demanding the cancellation of the BPSC examination.
  • He encouraged Tejashwi Yadav to take charge of the protests.
  • Kishor stated, “This is not a dharna. This is the passion of the people of Bihar to better their conditions.”
  • Students are calling for the cancellation of the Integrated Combined (Preliminary) Competitive Examination (CCE) 2024 due to alleged question paper leaks.
“He (Tejashwi Yadav) is a tall leader... We care about the agenda of the students,” said Kishor.

Kishor’s involvement highlights the rising tensions surrounding the BPSC exam and the political implications as various leaders weigh in.
newTitle: Prashant Kishor Joins BPSC Protest, Urges Tejashwi Yadav to Lead

title: Tamil Nadu CM Stalin announces $1 million prize for deciphering Indus Valley Script - The Hindu
summary:
Tamil Nadu CM Stalin announces $1 million prize for deciphering Indus Valley Script

Published: January 05, 2025 - Source: The Hindu

Tamil Nadu Chief Minister M.K. Stalin announced a $1 million prize for experts or organizations that succeed in deciphering the scripts of the Indus Valley Civilisation, stated during the centenary of its discovery.

  • The aim is to encourage research into the ancient scripts.
  • A ₹2 crore grant is established for research in honor of noted archaeologist Iravatham Mahadevan.
  • Stalin highlighted the historical connections between symbols found in the Indus Valley and those in Tamil Nadu.
  • He credited John Marshall’s discovery with altering perceptions about Indian civilization.
“His argument that Indus Valley Civilisation predated Aryan Civilization and the language spoken in the Indus Valley could be Dravidian has been strengthened further,” said Chief Minister Stalin.

This initiative aims to revive interest in ancient Tamil culture and its connections to early civilization, possibly reshaping historical narratives on the subject.
newTitle: Tamil Nadu CM Stalin announces $1 million prize for deciphering Indus Valley Script

title: HYDRAA demolishes 5-storey illegal building in Ayyappa Society, Madhapur - Deccan Chronicle
summary:
HYDRAA Demolishes Illegal 5-Storey Building in Ayyappa Society, Madhapur

Publication Date: Sunday
Source: Deccan Chronicle

The Disaster Response Force (DRF) personnel have begun demolishing a 5-storey illegally constructed building at 100 Feet Road in Ayyappa Society, following the Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation's (GHMC) directives and a High Court ruling declaring the structure illegal.

  • HYDRAA's action against illegal constructions continues in Madhapur.
  • The demolition started after inspections by Hydraa Commissioner Ranganath.
  • Power supply to the area was cut off, and police monitored traffic during the operation.
The Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) had issued notices to the building's owners last year.

This operation marks a significant step in enforcing building regulations in the city, aiming to curb illegal constructions.
newTitle: HYDRAA Demolishes Illegal 5-Storey Building in Ayyappa Society, Madhapur

OYO changes policy in Meerut, no check-ins for unmarried couples; may extend to more cities - The Times of India
summary:
OYO Changes Policy in Meerut, No Check-Ins for Unmarried Couples

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Times of India

OYO, a major hospitality service provider, has announced a new policy in Meerut that restricts check-ins for unmarried couples, with potential plans to extend this policy to other cities across India.

  • The policy addresses concerns related to safety and local regulations.
  • Customers report mixed reactions, with some fearing discrimination.
  • The company aims to better align with societal norms in certain regions.
  • This move raises questions about privacy and the rights of customers.
“The decision is made to ensure the safety of all guests, but it can feel restrictive on personal freedoms.”

OYO's policy changes may set a precedent for how the hospitality industry navigates cultural sensitivities in India.

title: Only married couples allowed: OYO revises guidelines, relationship proof required for check-in | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
Only married couples allowed: OYO revises guidelines, relationship proof required for check-in

Publication Date: Sunday | Source: PTI

Hotel booking company OYO has revised its check-in rules, now requiring proof of relationship for couples at partner hotels, starting in Meerut, Uttar Pradesh.

  • Unmarried couples can no longer check in.
  • Valid proof of relationship is mandatory for all bookings.
  • Hotels have discretion to accept or decline bookings.
  • OYO is responding to feedback from civil society groups.
  • Objective is to enhance brand image and improve safety for various traveler groups.
“OYO is committed to upholding safe and responsible hospitality practices... we also recognise our responsibility to listen to and work with the law enforcement and civil society groups.” - Pawas Sharma, OYO Region Head, North India

This policy aims to reflect changing perceptions and enhance safety for all guests.
newTitle: OYO's New Guidelines: Only Married Couples Allowed for Check-In

title: OYO revises rules in this city, unmarried couples won't be allowed to check-in - Hindustan Times
summary:
OYO Imposes New Check-in Rules for Unmarried Couples in Meerut

Date: January 05, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

OYO has introduced a new policy in Meerut, Uttar Pradesh, which prohibits unmarried couples from checking into hotels. This policy requires all couples to provide valid proof of their relationship during check-in.

  • New check-in policy effective in Meerut, Uttar Pradesh.
  • All couples must provide proof of relationship at check-in, regardless of reservations.
  • Policy implemented based on feedback from civil society groups.
  • May extend to other cities depending on response.
"OYO aims to transform its outdated perceptions and provide a safe experience for families and other travelers." - Pawas Sharma, Region Head, OYO North India.

This new policy by OYO reflects its response to requests for increased regulation on hotel check-ins for unmarried couples.
newTitle: OYO Imposes New Check-in Rules for Unmarried Couples in Meerut

title: "Teach Her A Lesson": Gujarat Man's Last Words Before Suicide - NDTV
summary:
Teach Her A Lesson: Gujarat Man's Last Words Before Suicide

Publication Date: December 30, 2023

Source: NDTV

The Gujarat police have registered a case against a woman for allegedly abetting her husband's suicide after he recorded a video urging his family to teach her a lesson.

  • Suresh Sathadiya, 39, was found hanging at his home in Zamrala village.
  • A video on his phone revealed his last request related to his wife's actions.
  • The FIR was registered based on a complaint from Sathadiya's father, alleging mental harassment by the wife.
  • The case is registered under section 108 (abetment of suicide) of the Bharatiya Nyay Sanhita.
“Teach my wife a lesson for causing my death,” said Sathadiya in the video.

This incident has raised serious concerns regarding mental health and domestic issues in the region.

title: India becomes world’s third-largest Metro network, achieves milestone of 1000 kms - India TV News
Goa’s tourism is changing, not dying. People don’t want ‘minibus tourists’ - ThePrint
summary:
Goa's Tourism: Evolving Beyond 'Minibus Tourists'

Publication Date: December 31, 2024 Source: The Print

As Goa faces scrutiny over declining tourist numbers, both tourists and locals express frustration about evolving travel norms and rising costs. While officials assure that tourism remains vibrant, many feel that a demographic shift is changing Goa's identity.

  • Social media showcases contrasts between busy tourist seasons and empty beaches.
  • Complaints arise about costs of travel and accommodation affecting domestic tourists.
  • Local officials dispute claims of declining tourism, attributing misinformation to influencers.
  • The pandemic led to an influx of urban professionals, altering Goa's tourist demographic.
  • Discussions reveal tensions between differing perceptions of tourism and its economic impact.
The true measure of the state’s future might not lie in tourist numbers or hotel occupancy, but in how it navigates this delicate moment of transformation.

Goa's tourism landscape is in flux, with a potential reinvention as it adapts to new realities and strives to balance the needs of locals and visitors.
newTitle: Goa's Tourism: Evolving Beyond 'Minibus Tourists'

title: BJP MLA claims ‘50,000 cows slaughtered daily in Uttar Pradesh’, accuses govt of silence - Hindustan Times
summary:
BJP MLA Claims 50,000 Cows Slaughtered Daily in Uttar Pradesh

Publication Date: Jan 05, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

BJP MLA Nand Kishore Gujar has alleged that the Yogi Adityanath government is complicit in the daily slaughter of 50,000 cows in Uttar Pradesh, expressing concerns over official corruption and urging resolution at the highest levels.

  • Nand Kishore Gujar claims 50,000 cows are slaughtered every day under the current government.
  • He alleges that corrupt officials are misusing funds meant for cow welfare.
  • Gujar expresses frustration over the lack of government action on this issue.
  • He warns that unchecked corruption could affect the BJP's performance in the upcoming elections.
  • Akhilesh Yadav criticizes BJP infighting and its impact on public interests.
  • A separate incident highlights a lynching in Moradabad linked to cow slaughter accusations.
“If action is taken against these corrupt officials, the BJP could win as many as 375 seats in the next assembly elections.”

title: Cop Dead, 4 Naxals Killed In Encounter With Security Forces In Chhattisgarh - News18
summary:
Cop Dead, 4 Naxals Killed In Encounter With Security Forces In Chhattisgarh

Date: January 05, 2025

Source: News18

In an ongoing encounter between Naxalites and security forces in Chhattisgarh, four Naxals and a police constable were killed during a fierce confrontation.

  • The operation, which began on Saturday evening, involved teams from the District Reserve Guard (DRG) and Special Task Force (STF) across four districts.
  • Ian Dantewada, DRG Head Constable Sannu Karam was among those killed in action.
  • The operation remains active with continued searches in the South Abujmarh forest area.
  • A cache of weapons including an AK-47 and an SLR was seized from the encounter site.
  • This encounter adds to a string of recent operations that have seen heightened activity against Naxalites in the region.
“A total of two 12-bore guns, Naxal uniforms, literature, explosives, and other Naxal materials were recovered from the spot.”

The ongoing operations signify a concentrated effort by security forces to dismantle the Naxalite presence in Chhattisgarh.
newTitle: Cop Dead, 4 Naxals Killed In Encounter With Security Forces In Chhattisgarh

title: What India focused on 10 years ago vs today? Rahul Gandhi responds - The Times of India
36 Rafale Fighters For IAF An ‘Expensive, Unprofitable Decision’, Dumping MMRCA A Blunder: Ex-Indian Air Marshal - EurAsian Times
summary:
36 Rafale Fighters For IAF An 'Expensive, Unprofitable Decision', Dumping MMRCA A Blunder: Ex-Indian Air Marshal

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: EurAsian Times

The Indian Air Force (IAF) is facing criticism over its decision to purchase 36 Rafale fighters instead of advancing the 126 Medium Multi Role Combat Aircraft (MMRCA) deal. Retired Air Marshal M. Matheswaran emphasizes that this decision was costly and ultimately did not benefit the Indian defense manufacturing sector.

  • The IAF initially sought to acquire 126 Mirage 2000 II aircraft in 2000, which led to a protracted acquisition process.
  • In 2016, the Indian government scrapped the MMRCA deal, opting to procure 36 Rafales as an emergency measure.
  • Matheswaran argues that the failure to complete the MMRCA deal was a significant error, denying India world-class manufacturing and technology transfer opportunities.
  • The current fighter fleet is dwindling, necessitating further acquisitions for operational readiness.
“Going for 36 Rafales was not the best option as it was not only expensive, it also did not benefit the Indian industry at all,” says Matheswaran.

In conclusion, the IAF's urgent need for modern aircraft has led to controversial procurement decisions, with ongoing calls for a reevaluation of defense procurement strategies to better serve national interests.
newTitle: 36 Rafale Fighters For IAF An 'Expensive, Unprofitable Decision', Dumping MMRCA A Blunder: Ex-Indian Air Marshal

title: 4 Maoists Gunned Down, 1 Security Personnel Dies In Chhattisgarh Encounter - NDTV
summary:
Four Maoists Killed in Chhattisgarh Encounter, One Security Personnel Dies

Publication Date: Today | Source: NDTV

An encounter between Maoists and security forces in Chhattisgarh's Bastar region resulted in the deaths of four Maoists and one security personnel. The clash occurred during an anti-Maoist operation in the forests of Narayanpur and Dantewada districts.

  • Four Maoists were killed during a face-off with security personnel.
  • One head constable from the District Reserve Guard (DRG) named Sannu Karam lost his life.
  • Security forces were conducting an anti-Maoist operation when the encounter took place.
  • After the exchange of fire, bodies of the Maoists and their weapons were recovered.
  • In 2024, over 200 Maoists have been killed, with a focus on eradicating this insurgency by March 2026.
  • 18 security personnel have reportedly died in anti-Maoist operations this year, alongside 65 civilians due to Maoist violence.
“Amit Shah vowing to eradicate them by March 2026.”

The ongoing operations highlight the persistent conflict between security forces and Maoist insurgents in the region, with the government emphasizing its commitment to restoring peace.
newTitle: Four Maoists Killed in Chhattisgarh Encounter, One Security Personnel Dies

title: Centre appoints Justice Mayank Kumar Jain as Judicial Member of SAT - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
summary:
Justice Mayank Kumar Jain Appointed as Judicial Member of SAT

Published on: 05 Jan 2025, 3:29 am

The Central government has appointed Justice Mayank Kumar Jain, a former judge of the Allahabad High Court, as the second judicial member of the Securities Appellate Tribunal (SAT), as notified on January 3, 2025.

  • Justice Jain's appointment was confirmed through a gazette notification issued by the Union Finance Ministry.
  • The SAT operates under the SEBI Act and handles appeals against SEBI and IRDAI decisions.
  • Currently, SAT functions with a single bench led by Justice Dinesh Kumar.
  • Justice Jain's appointment may lead to the establishment of a second bench at the SAT.
  • He has a considerable judicial background and was appointed as a permanent judge of the Allahabad High Court in September 2023.
"In exercise of powers conferred by Sub-section (2) of Section 3 and clause (ii) of section 5 of the Tribunals Reforms Act, 2021... the Central Government hereby appoints Justice Mayank Kumar Jain, Former Judge, High Court of Allahabad, as Judicial Member of the Securities Appellate Tribunal."

Justice Jain brings extensive legal experience, having practiced since 1985 and serving as a judge since 2022. His addition is expected to enhance the operational capacity of the SAT.
newTitle: Justice Mayank Kumar Jain Appointed as Judicial Member of SAT

title: Four Naxalites, cop killed in encounter in Chhattisgarh’s Dantewada - The Hindu
summary:
Four Naxalites, cop killed in encounter in Chhattisgarh’s Dantewada

Date: January 5, 2025 | Source: The Hindu

Four Naxalites were killed in an encounter with security forces in Chhattisgarh’s Bastar region, along with a head constable of the District Reserve Guard (DRG) who also lost his life.

  • The gunfight occurred on Saturday evening in a forest area during an anti-Naxalite operation.
  • Bodies of the Naxalites and their weapons, including AK-47s, were recovered at the scene.
  • Chief Minister Vishnu Deo Sai pledged to continue the fight against Naxalism.
  • In 2024, 219 Naxalites were neutralized in such encounters throughout the state.
“His sacrifice will not go in vain. Security forces have been fighting very strongly against Naxalism.” - Chief Minister Vishnu Deo Sai

This encounter highlights the ongoing struggle between security forces and Naxalite groups in the region, aiming for greater stability and safety.
newTitle: Four Naxalites and a Police Officer Killed in Chhattisgarh Encounter
